holidays.name: National Pastry Day
holidays.description: A day dedicated to celebrating all things flaky, buttery, and delicious in the world of pastries. From croissants to danishes, it's a perfect excuse to indulge in sweet and savory baked treats!
holidays.origin: Originating from various bakery promotions, this day has become an unofficial sweet tooth celebration observed mostly in the USA.
holidays.funFact: The croissant, a pastry synonymous with France, actually has roots tracing back to Austria, and was popularized in Paris in the 19th century.

holidays.name: Christmas Card Day
holidays.description: A quirky celebration marking the anniversary of the first commercial Christmas card ever produced. Time to send quirky, beautiful, or downright weird holiday cards to friends and family!
holidays.origin: The first commercial Christmas card was commissioned by Sir Henry Cole in England in 1843.
holidays.funFact: The original Christmas card featured a family drinking wine, which raised some eyebrows at the time!

holidays.name: Weary Willie Day

holidays.origin: This day commemorates the creation of the 'Weary Willie and Tired Tim' comic strip characters first introduced in the Depression-era cartoons.
holidays.funFact: The comic strip ran for decades and helped bring humor and hope during hard economic times.

holidays.name: Monkey Day
holidays.description: An unusual holiday for monkey lovers and primate enthusiasts to celebrate all kinds of monkeys and the importance of their conservation.
holidays.origin: Created by monkey enthusiasts in 2000, itâ€™s an unofficial day observed globally with events and educational campaigns.
holidays.funFact: Monkey Day is celebrated by dressing up as monkeys, visiting zoos, and learning about primate preservation.
